text: In a agile clinical system in retail where new members are onboarding and support teams must be enabled, what should the project manager do to discuss project responsibilities within the team?

options.label: hold a roles and responsibilities session using a RACI or similar
assume everyone knows their role
assign roles privately without discussion
avoid clarifying roles to save time

explanation: Option a is correct because structured discussion clarifies ownership. Option b is incorrect because assumptions cause gaps and duplication. Option c is incorrect because hidden assignments reduce buy-in. Option d is incorrect because lack of clarity slows delivery later.

text: Given a hybrid policy implementation in retail where teams are cross-functional and remote and several partners collaborate, which action best supports discuss project responsibilities within the team?

options.label: wait for conflict before defining responsibilities
confirm understanding and resolve overlaps
rely solely on job titles for role clarity
assume everyone knows their role

explanation: Option b is correct because shared understanding prevents conflict. Option a is incorrect because reactive clarity costs time. Option c is incorrect because titles do not capture project duties. Option d is incorrect because assumptions cause gaps and duplication.

text: While facing a vendor-led clinical system in pharma where teams are cross-functional and remote and several partners collaborate, what is the most effective next step to discuss project responsibilities within the team?

options.label: assign roles privately without discussion
avoid clarifying roles to save time
document and share the responsibility map
wait for conflict before defining responsibilities

explanation: Option c is correct because visibility helps alignment. Option a is incorrect because hidden assignments reduce buy-in. Option b is incorrect because lack of clarity slows delivery later. Option d is incorrect because reactive clarity costs time.

text: For a federated POS refresh in fintech where handoffs across time zones are rough and delivery pressure is high, what should the project manager do first to discuss project responsibilities within the team?

options.label: rely solely on job titles for role clarity
assume everyone knows their role
assign roles privately without discussion
update roles as the project evolves

explanation: Option d is correct because dynamic projects need refreshed clarity. Option a is incorrect because titles do not capture project duties. Option b is incorrect because assumptions cause gaps and duplication. Option c is incorrect because hidden assignments reduce buy-in.

text: In a matrixed POS refresh in fintech where teams are cross-functional and remote and delivery pressure is high, what should the project manager do to discuss project responsibilities within the team?

options.label: align responsibilities with skills and capacity
avoid clarifying roles to save time
wait for conflict before defining responsibilities
rely solely on job titles for role clarity

explanation: Option a is correct because fit drives effectiveness. Option b is incorrect because lack of clarity slows delivery later. Option c is incorrect because reactive clarity costs time. Option d is incorrect because titles do not capture project duties.
